intro: Fimbristylis micheliana, commonly known as the slender spike-rush, is a herbaceous plant belonging to the Cyperaceae family. It is characterized by its grass-like appearance, with narrow, linear leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in wet or moist environments such as marshes, swamps, and along stream banks. Its flowering spikes are usually erect and can range from 10 to 30 centimeters in height. Fimbristylis micheliana plays an important ecological role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for various small organisms.
